alert.note: Alert for El Paso; Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 4:41AM CST until March 01 at 8:00PM CST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 7 PM MST TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO AND FAR WEST TEXAS DUE TO DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS... .Southwest flow ahead of a Pacific low pressure system will allow winds to increase this afternoon. Strong southwest winds 20 to 30 mph combined with dry air and relative humidity below 15% will lead to high fire danger. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND VERY DRY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055, 056, 112, AND 113... * AFFECTED AREA...In Far West Texas, El Paso and Hudspeth Counties. In south-central New Mexico, portions of Otero, Sierra, and Dona Ana Counties. * 20 FOOT WIND...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
